definition[0]: a road that goes around a town or other busy area rather than through it
definition[1]: a tube that allows gas or liquid to flow around something rather than through it
definition[2]: to go around a town or other busy place rather than through it
example[0]: Interstate 8 bypasses the town to the north.
definition[3]: to avoid obeying a rule, system, or someone in an official position
example[1]: Francis bypassed his manager and wrote straight to the director.
definition[4]: to avoid something such as a law, rule, or system, or to avoid involving someone in a process
example[2]: Companies will always try to bypass laws aimed at protecting workersâ€™ rights.
example[3]: Customers can buy direct from producers and bypass the middleman.
